Package edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.logic

Interface Substitution

All Superinterfaces:
Function<Object,Object>
All Known Implementing Classes:
HashSubstitution
public interface Substitution extends Function<Object,Object>
A substitution is a function which maps one set of objects to other objects that will replace them. Substitutions are often used to replace the variables or fluents in a logical formula with values.
Author:
Stephen G. Ware

  • Method Details

    • canSubstitute

      static boolean canSubstitute(Object original, Object replacement, Substitution substitution)
      Checks whether a replacement object can be substituted for some original object in a given substitution. Substitutions are allowed or disallowed in the following cases:
      • If the substitution already maps the original to that replacement, the substitution is allowed.
      • If the substitution already maps the original to a different replacement, the substitution is not allowed.
      • If the original object is a variable and the replacement is a typed formula of the variable's type, the substitution is allowed.
      • If the original object is a fluent and the replacement is a typed formula of the fluent's type, the substitution is allowed.
      • Otherwise, the substitution is not allowed.
      Note that this method does not modify the substitution; it only checks whether a hypothetical substitution would be allowed.
      Parameters:
      original - the original object that would be replaced
      replacement - the object that the original would be replaced with
      substitution - an existing substitution to which the proposed replacement would be added
      Returns:
      true if the substitution is allowed, false otherwise

    • canSubstitute

      static boolean canSubstitute(Object original, Object replacement)
      Checks whether a proposed substitution is allowed in an empty substitution.
      Parameters:
      original - the original object that would be replaced
      replacement - the object that the original would be replaced with
      Returns:
      true if the substitution is allowed, false otherwise

    • canSubstitute

      static boolean canSubstitute(Object[] originals, Object[] replacements, Substitution substitution)
      Checks whether a series of proposed substitutions is allowed given an existing substitution. The first original object would be replaced by the first replacement object, the second original by the second replacement, etc. This method does not modify the substitution.
      Parameters:
      originals - an array of original objects that would be replaced
      replacements - an array of objects that the originals would be replaced with, which should be the same size as the originals array
      substitution - an existing substitution to which the proposed replacements would be added
      Returns:
      true if the substitutions are allowed, false otherwise
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the number of original objects does not match the number of replacement objects

    • canSubstitute

      static boolean canSubstitute(Object[] originals, Object[] replacements)
      Checks whether a series of proposed substitutions is allowed in an empty substitution.
      Parameters:
      originals - an array of original objects that would be replaced
      replacements - an array of objects that the originals would be replaced with, which should be the same size as the originals array
      Returns:
      true if the substitutions are allowed, false otherwise
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the number of original objects does not match the number of replacement objects

    • canSubstitute

      static boolean canSubstitute(Iterable<?> originals, Iterable<?> replacements, Substitution substitution)
      Checks whether a series of proposed substitutions is allowed given an existing substitution. The first original object would be replaced by the first replacement object, the second original by the second replacement, etc. This method does not modify the substitution.
      Parameters:
      originals - an iterable of original objects that would be replaced
      replacements - an iterable of objects that the originals would be replaced with, which should have the same number of elements as the originals iterable
      substitution - an existing substitution to which the proposed replacements would be added
      Returns:
      true if the substitutions are allowed, false otherwise
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the number of original objects does not match the number of replacement objects

    • canSubstitute

      static boolean canSubstitute(Iterable<?> originals, Iterable<?> replacements)
      Checks whether a series of proposed substitutions is allowed in an empty substitution.
      Parameters:
      originals - an iterable of original objects that would be replaced
      replacements - an iterable of objects that the originals would be replaced with, which should have the same number of elements as the originals iterable
      Returns:
      true if the substitutions are allowed, false otherwise
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the number of original objects does not match the number of replacement objects

    • replace

      Substitution replace(Object original, Object replacement)
      Returns a substitution in which maps a given original object to a given replacement. Depending on how the substitution is implemented, this method may modify this substitution and return itself or it may return a new substitution with the added mapping. This method does not necessarily check whether the substitution is allowed.
      Parameters:
      original - the original object to be replaced
      replacement - the object to replace the original with
      Returns:
      a substitution which maps the original object to its replacement
